result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J E Barry Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of payment defendant to serve an additional 5 days jail - concurrent to the 12 months jail.

With Huber.
Standard release conditions.
122 days credit granted.
Court will allow to be served in another county.

**Defendant to be returned to Outagamie County Jail Forthwith**
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Mcmahon advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Isaiah J E Barry Moore in court, in custody (OTP'd from Outagamie County Jail), with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
12 Months Jail to be served with huber (all standard release conditions).
122 Days Credit.
Court will allow to be served in anyother county.


COSTS:  $268
DRGOD:  $10
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid - FORTHWITH - In lieu of payment defendant to serve an additional 5 days jail - concurrent to the 12 months jail

Defendant to be returned to Outagamie County Jail - FORTHWITH.

09:21 AM Defendant Isaiah J E Barry Moore appeared by Zoom, in custody at Outagamie County Jail, with attorney Steve Hughes for attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
THE DEFENDANT IS IN CUSTODY AT OUTAGAMIE COUNT JAIL, HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT IS LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Request for adjournment
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 03-29-2022. "Please expand upon "in compliance with victim's rights." Has the alleged victim been notified and okayed the adjournment?"  
**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 03-31-2022. "The matter should remain on for the same time and date but may be converted to a status date for scheduling future dates"

Adjourn Preliminary Hearing
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 03-28-2022. "There is an alleged victim so the matter may not be adjourned off the record. It may be adjourned, however, upon receipt of approval from victim/witness. Absent that, the April 20, 2022, date will remain on the calendar as a prelim status date."
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
